title: analysis
text: vignette documents assign4nspack datasets curated NEON sensor products shows quick analyses mirror questions explored Shiny app. Goals Describe data sources preparation (time window, QC, hourly aggregation). Provide light EDA understand coverage site/sensor. Show compact example nitrate–water quality relationship. Point readers interactive app deeper exploration.

title: analysis
text: derive hourly datasets publicly available NEON products: DP1.20288.001 — Aquatic Instrumentation: Water Quality (WQ) variables: conductivity (cond_uScm), dissolved oxygen (do_mgL), turbidity (turb_FNU) DP1.20033.001 — Nitrate Surface Water (NSW) variable: nitrate (nitrate_umolL) Data used educational purposes.

title: analysis
text: Time window: 2018-01-01 2019-12-31. Quality filtering: keep measurements NEON quality flag QF == 0 available. Aggregation: raw 15-min values → hourly means using lubridate::floor_date. Join keys: site, sensor (S1_upstream, S2_downstream), date_time (UTC). full preparation steps implemented package’s data-raw/ scripts.

title: analysis
code: library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(ggplot2) library(scales)  # quick structure dplyr::glimpse(wq_nitrate) ## Rows: 62,139 ## Columns: 7 ## $ site          <chr> "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", … ## $ sensor        <chr> "S1_upstream", "S1_upstream", "S1_upstream", "S1_upstrea… ## $ date_time     <dttm> 2019-01-03 16:00:00, 2019-01-03 17:00:00, 2019-01-03 18… ## $ cond_uScm     <dbl> 542.3400, 540.3288, 537.1060, 535.5428, 535.4665, 536.33… ## $ do_mgL        <dbl> 8.442500, 8.558167, 8.781667, 8.959333, 9.091833, 9.1450… ## $ turb_FNU      <dbl> 0.8062500, 0.7151667, 0.6653333, 0.6310000, 0.6008333, 0… ## $ nitrate_umolL <dbl> NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, N…

title: analysis
text: simple bar chart nitrate availability:
code: coverage <- wq_nitrate |> summarise( n_hours         = dplyr::n(), n_nonNA_nitrate = sum(!is.na(nitrate_umolL)), pct_nitrate     = n_nonNA_nitrate / n_hours , .by = c(site, sensor)) |> arrange(site, sensor)  coverage ## # A tibble: 6 × 5 ##   site  sensor        n_hours n_nonNA_nitrate pct_nitrate ##   <chr> <chr>           <int>           <int>       <dbl> ## 1 ARIK  S1_upstream      7557               0       0     ## 2 ARIK  S2_downstream   15541            9894       0.637 ## 3 CARI  S1_upstream      4249               0       0     ## 4 CARI  S2_downstream    5277            5129       0.972 ## 5 LEWI  S1_upstream     14001               0       0     ## 6 LEWI  S2_downstream   15514            9333       0.602 ggplot(coverage, aes(x = site, y = pct_nitrate, fill = sensor)) + geom_col(position = position_dodge(width = 0.7)) + scale_y_continuous(labels = percent) + labs(title = "Share of hourly timestamps with nitrate present", x = "Site", y = "Coverage", fill = "Sensor") + theme_minimal()

title: analysis
text: Nitrate–water quality relationship illustrate one relationship app explores interactively: nitrate vs dissolved oxygen. Downstream sensors (S2_downstream) usually richest nitrate coverage.  Correlation (pooled across sites S2_downstream): (Interpretation example: small positive/negative r indicates weak linear association; see app site-specific views LOESS fits.)
code: wq_nitrate |> summarise( start = min(date_time), end   = max(date_time), .by   = c(site, sensor) ) |> arrange(site, sensor) ## # A tibble: 6 × 4 ##   site  sensor        start               end                 ##   <chr> <chr>         <dttm>              <dttm>              ## 1 ARIK  S1_upstream   2019-01-03 16:00:00 2019-12-31 23:00:00 ## 2 ARIK  S2_downstream 2018-01-03 22:00:00 2019-12-31 23:00:00 ## 3 CARI  S1_upstream   2018-06-07 02:00:00 2019-09-24 23:00:00 ## 4 CARI  S2_downstream 2018-06-12 19:00:00 2019-09-24 23:00:00 ## 5 LEWI  S1_upstream   2018-01-03 21:00:00 2019-12-31 23:00:00 ## 6 LEWI  S2_downstream 2018-01-01 00:00:00 2019-12-31 23:00:00 df_rel <- wq_nitrate |> filter(sensor == "S2_downstream") |> select(site, sensor, date_time, do_mgL, nitrate_umolL) |> drop_na(do_mgL, nitrate_umolL)  ggplot(df_rel, aes(x = do_mgL, y = nitrate_umolL, colour = site)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.5, size = 1) + geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = FALSE) + labs(x = "Dissolved oxygen (mg/L)", y = "Nitrate (\u00B5mol/L)", title = "Nitrate vs dissolved oxygen (S2_downstream)") + theme_minimal() ct <- suppressWarnings(cor.test(df_rel$do_mgL, df_rel$nitrate_umolL)) data.frame( r = unname(ct$estimate), p_value = ct$p.value ) ##           r       p_value ## 1 0.2542486 7.020114e-265

title: Explore High-Frequency Water-Quality and Nitrate Relationships
text: assign4nspack teaching-focused R package exploring high-frequency freshwater water-quality nitrate relationships using data derived National Ecological Observatory Network (NEON). provides: Cleaned, curated hourly datasets (wq_hourly, nitrate_hourly, wq_nitrate) Data-processing scripts data-raw/ interactive Shiny app visualise water-quality nitrate trends across sites Full documentation reproducible examples built roxygen2 pkgdown

title: Explore High-Frequency Water-Quality and Nitrate Relationships
text: can install development version assign4nspack GitHub : load package:

title: Explore High-Frequency Water-Quality and Nitrate Relationships
text: package ships three tidy datasets prepared NEON sensor data:

title: Explore High-Frequency Water-Quality and Nitrate Relationships
text: Data sourced NEON freshwater sites covering period January 2018 December 2019. site, upstream (S1_upstream) downstream (S2_downstream) sensors used available. Raw 15-minute observations NEON products DP1.20288.001 (Water Quality) DP1.20033.001 (Nitrate) aggregated hourly means, quality-filtered (QF == 0), merged site, sensor, date_time. final datasets include hourly records multiple NEON stream sites consistent study period described Kermorvant et al. (2023): > “Understanding links water-quality variables nitrate concentration freshwater streams using high-frequency sensor data.” ensures datasets reflect comparable temporal coverage data quality published analysis.

title: Explore High-Frequency Water-Quality and Nitrate Relationships
code: library(dplyr) data("wq_nitrate", package = "assign4nspack") glimpse(wq_nitrate) #> Rows: 62,139 #> Columns: 7 #> $ site          <chr> "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", "ARIK", … #> $ sensor        <chr> "S1_upstream", "S1_upstream", "S1_upstream", "S1_upstrea… #> $ date_time     <dttm> 2019-01-03 16:00:00, 2019-01-03 17:00:00, 2019-01-03 18… #> $ cond_uScm     <dbl> 542.3400, 540.3288, 537.1060, 535.5428, 535.4665, 536.33… #> $ do_mgL        <dbl> 8.442500, 8.558167, 8.781667, 8.959333, 9.091833, 9.1450… #> $ turb_FNU      <dbl> 0.8062500, 0.7151667, 0.6653333, 0.6310000, 0.6008333, 0… #> $ nitrate_umolL <dbl> NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, NaN, N…

title: Explore High-Frequency Water-Quality and Nitrate Relationships
text: site — 4-letter NEON site identifier (e.g., ARIK, LEWI) sensor — sensor position (S1_upstream, S2_downstream) date_time — hourly timestamp (UTC) cond_uScm, do_mgL, turb_FNU — water-quality variables nitrate_umolL — nitrate concentration (µmol/L)

title: Hourly water quality by site — wq_hourly
Hourly water quality by site — wq_hourly
text: tibble/data frame N rows 6 variables: date_time POSIXct. Timestamp local time UTC (state one). site chr. Site identifier (e.g., "XYZ"). sensor chr. Sensor identifier type. cond_uScm dbl. Specific conductivity (µS/cm). do_mgL dbl. Dissolved oxygen (mg/L). turb_FNU dbl. Turbidity (FNU).

title: Hourly water quality by site — wq_hourly
text: NEON products (list product codes + processing steps).

what: Joined hourly water quality and nitrate data — wq_nitrate
title: Joined hourly water quality and nitrate data — wq_nitrate
text: Combines NEON water-quality (DP1.20288.001) nitrate (DP1.20033.001) products. Nitrate data available primarily downstream sensors; upstream sensors may missing values.

title: Joined hourly water quality and nitrate data — wq_nitrate
text: data frame columns: site Site code (4-letter). sensor Sensor position: "S1_upstream" "S2_downstream". date_time Hourly timestamp (UTC). cond_uScm Specific conductivity (µS/cm). do_mgL Dissolved oxygen (mg/L). turb_FNU Turbidity (FNU). nitrate_umolL Nitrate concentration (µmol/L). May missing upstream sensors.

title: Joined hourly water quality and nitrate data — wq_nitrate
text: NEON data products DP1.20288.001 DP1.20033.001.
